quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, According to the US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) definition of "cloud computing," what is the meaning of the statement "a shared pool of configurable computing resources"? | Five essential characteristics, three deployment, and three service models. | Networks, servers, storage, applications, and services. | Data security associated with data loss or unavailability causing business disruption. | Leveraging cloud services over the open internet on hardware owned by the cloud provider.
quizSrc.definition: Networks, servers, storage, applications, and services.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, What tasks do hypervisors accomplish? | Facilitate access to mainframes for multiple users to access the same data storage layer | Enable multiple operating systems to run alongside each other and separate VMs logically | Scale on demand to support fluctuating workloads | Fluctuates workloads and facilitates access to mainframes
quizSrc.definition: Enable multiple operating systems to run alongside each other and separate VMs logically

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which key considerations drive an organization's selection of cloud computing when considering expenditure for off-the-shelf software and investments in upgrades? | Risk exposure | Infrastructure and workloads | Software as a service and development platforms | Speed and productivity
quizSrc.definition: Software as a service and development platforms

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of the following statements describes a benefit of cloud computing? | Hardware failures do not result in data loss because of backups maintained on the network | Business continuity | Data security associated with loss or unavailability of data | Lack of standardization in how the constantly evolving technologies integrate
quizSrc.definition: Hardware failures do not result in data loss because of backups maintained on the network

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which service provider provides one of the largest cloud-based data management platforms? | Oracle Cloud | Salesforce | Amazon Web Services | Alibaba Cloud

Quiz type: radio, Which service provider uses its cloud platform internally for their end-user products, such as Search and app engines that automatically allocate and de-allocate resources to handle demand? | Oracle Cloud | Google Cloud Platform (GCP) | SAP | Microsoft Azure

Quiz type: radio, According to the International Data Corporation (IDC), what is that crucial ability that will make cloud computing essential for businesses to succeed, sustain, and compete in today's markets? | Data-driven decisions | Applied exponential technologies such as AI, Automation, IoT, and Blockchain | Multi-cloud infrastructures | Cognitively enabled workflows

Quiz type: radio, Why did American Airlines require a new technology platform? | Requirement for better customer service | Establishment of a scalable hosting platform for low-latency delivery | Removal of barriers to innovation | Acceleration of growth
quizSrc.definition: Establishment of a scalable hosting platform for low-latency delivery

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Select the answer that best describes how does Cloud Computing helps IoT devices? | Stores data on an encrypted physical drive | Provides a fixed physical location for the data collected from IoT devices | Draws insights from data collected from the IoT devices and users | Provides the resources to store and process the data produced by IoT devices and users.
quizSrc.definition: Provides the resources to store and process the data produced by IoT devices and users.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of the following denotes the relationship between Blockchain, AI, and cloud? | Blockchain provides the distributed computing resources, AI powers the analytics, and the cloud records the data | Blockchain lends trust and transparency to AI by recording the data and variables that go into a decision made in an AI algorithm, and the cloud provides an immutable network | Blockchain provides a decentralized source of truth, AI powers analytics and decision-making, and the cloud provides globally distributed computing resources | Blockchain provides an immutable network, AI provides distributed computing resources and cloud powers decision-making
quizSrc.definition: Blockchain provides a decentralized source of truth, AI powers analytics and decision-making, and the cloud provides globally distributed computing resources

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, In which cloud service model does the service provider manage the application data along with the infrastructure and platform resources ? | PaaS | CaaS | SaaS | IaaS
Quiz type: radio, In which IaaS cloud environment can the customers deploy their middleware and install applications? | IoT | Virtual Machines | Blockchain | AI

Quiz type: radio, What is one of the concerns in cloud infrastructure configuration and management? | Dependency on a third party for workload availability and performance | Scaling infrastructure up and down as demand fluctuates | Business continuity and disaster recovery | Solving complex problems involving millions of variables and calculations
quizSrc.definition: Dependency on a third party for workload availability and performance

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, What is the responsibility of a user in the PaaS model? | Business process management systems |  Database management systems | Workload management | Application code and its maintenance

Quiz type: radio, Which capability in the PaaS model eliminates the need for the integration of disparate components? | APIs for services | Runtime environment | Rapid deployment mechanisms | Business analytics services

Quiz type: radio, Which is a characteristic of the SaaS model? | Applications reside on a remote cloud network | Infrastructure and code are maintained by the users | Users can see only their own application | Services are free for the users on the SaaS cloud
quizSrc.definition: Applications reside on a remote cloud network

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, What is the users’ role in a public cloud?  | Users don’t own the servers their applications run on | Users maintain the platform that runs their application | Users can manage the operations of the servers | Users own the storage their data consumes
quizSrc.definition: Users don’t own the servers their applications run on

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, What is a feature of a private cloud?  | Uncontrolled access | Application portability | Limited security | Use of external computing resources

Quiz type: radio, If an organization needs to run a highly sensitive and mission-critical application with unpredictable performance and capacity requirements, which of the following models would best meet its requirements?  | Hybrid Cloud | Private Cloud | On-premise Data Centers | Public Cloud

Quiz type: radio, What do you mean by “cloud bursting”?  | You can move applications and data between on-premises and cloud systems | You can leverage public cloud instances for a period of time but return to the private cloud when the surge is met | You can spin-up environments using pay-as-you-go in the public cloud | You can incrementally modernize your core business systems
quizSrc.definition: You can leverage public cloud instances for a period of time but return to the private cloud when the surge is met

Quiz type: radio, Each Cloud Region can have multiple Availability Zones. What are Zones ? | Geographic area or region where the cloud provider’s infrastructure is clustered  | Standardized containers of computing resources | Single shared point of failure  | Unique physical locations with one or more data centers

Gemini
quizSrc.definition: Unique physical locations with one or more data centers

Quiz type: radio, Which of the following is a benefit of virtualization? | Runs a single operating system | Is secure | Cost savings

Gemini | Increases your downtime

Gemini | Transient or Spot VMs | Dedicated hosts | Shared or Public Cloud VMs

Quiz type: radio, Which of the following is a feature of bare metal servers? | Multiple tenants | Low cost to use | High performance and secure

Gemini | Rapidly provisioned

Gemini

Preventing malicious code in one container from impacting other containers

quizSrc.term:
Quiz type: radio, Which of the following storage types are ephemeral or non-persistent? | File storage | Direct Attached storage

Gemini | Object storage | Block storage

Quiz type: radio, What makes File storage an ideal solution for scenarios where shared storage is required? | File storage can be mounted from remote storage appliances  | Fast accessibility of file storage over the network | File storage can be mounted on multiple compute nodes at the same time 

Gemini | File Storage is mounted to compute nodes via an ethernet network
quizSrc.definition:
File storage can be mounted on multiple compute nodes at the same time 

Gemini

quizSrc.term:
Quiz type: radio, Which of the following scenarios is best suited for Block Storage? | Low cost is a consideration | Where workloads do not require fast connectivity to storage | Workloads that need disk sharing between compute nodes  | Applications that need consistent fast access to the disk, such as databases

Gemini
quizSrc.definition:
Applications that need consistent fast access to the disk, such as databases

Gemini

quizSrc.term:
Quiz type: radio, Which of the following is a feature of Object storage? | Object Storage can be mounted on multiple compute nodes via an ethernet network | You can directly use Object Storage without attaching it to a compute node

Gemini | Storage is attached to compute nodes using a fiber network | Used where fast read and write speeds are necessary
quizSrc.definition:
You can directly use Object Storage without attaching it to a compute node

Gemini

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of the following options describes a development principle, or action, for cloud native applications? | Combine applications to create microservices with multiple functions. | Containerize the microservices for maximum flexibility, scalability, and portability. | Tightly coupling the different functions of the application so that they can work together as a whole. | Bring the various single-function components of an application into one huge piece of software.
quizSrc.definition: Containerize the microservices for maximum flexibility, scalability, and portability.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of the following statements describes the DevOps approach and process? | Eliminates the need to provision servers, build middleware, and install application code. | A collaborative approach where business owners and development, operations, and quality assurance teams collaborate to deliver software continuously. | Eliminates the need to monitor performance and availability. | Allows teams to freely build, deploy, and manage cloud native applications according to an informal, loosely defined set of guidelines.
quizSrc.definition: A collaborative approach where business owners and development, operations, and quality assurance teams collaborate to deliver software continuously.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of the provided options encapsulates the complete application modernization journey? | The journey from the waterfall and agile development methodologies to DevOps. | The journey from monolithic and service-oriented architecture to microservices architecture. | The journey from monolithic and service-oriented architecture to microservices architecture, from physical servers and VMs to cloud infrastructure, and from the waterfall and agile methodology to DevOps. | The journey from physical servers and VMs to cloud infrastructure
quizSrc.definition: The journey from monolithic and service-oriented architecture to microservices architecture, from physical servers and VMs to cloud infrastructure, and from the waterfall and agile methodology to DevOps.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, How would a global flower delivery company leverage the Hybrid Multicloud architecture to meet its requirement of varying capacity demands across different geographies? | By scaling up their on-premises architecture | By using the automatic provisioning and de-provisioning of resources that the cloud offers. | By distributing their delivery service application across multiple cloud environments and providers spread across multiple geographies.
quizSrc.definition: By distributing their delivery service application across multiple cloud environments and providers spread across multiple geographies.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of the following statements describes the DevOps approach and process? | DevOps process is a collaborative approach that defines how people build, deploy, and manage applications in a cloud-native environment to deliver software continuously. | An approach that utilizes cloud applications to monitor systems. | Eliminates the need to monitor performance and availability. | Eliminates the need to provision servers, build middleware, and install application code.
quizSrc.definition: DevOps process is a collaborative approach that defines how people build, deploy, and manage applications in a cloud-native environment to deliver software continuously.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of these scenarios is NOT a good use case for serverless architecture? | Microservices that can be built as stateless functions | Supporting microservices architecture | Workloads characterized by long-running processes | Stream processing workloads

Quiz type: radio,  How can the microservices architecture approach be characterized ?  |  Compulsion to bundle all microservices for a specific task into a single container.   |  Impact on the entire application when one microservice ceases to function.   |  Decomposition of large applications into core functions to construct a comprehensive and functional application.   |  Requirement to build every new functionality in a microservice from the ground up.
quizSrc.definition: Decomposition of large applications into core functions to construct a comprehensive and functional application.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Fill in the blank. Microservices architecture is an approach in which a ______________ comprises many loosely coupled and independently deployable smaller components or services. | Repository application  | Server | Cloud service  | Single application
Quiz type: radio, What does a cloud native application consist of? | Microservices | Executable containers | Application containers | Executable files
Quiz type: radio, DevOps and Cloud share a _________ relationship. | Vendor | Symbiotic | General partnership | Customer
Quiz type: radio, Fill in the blank. _____________ is a key part of an enterprise's digital transformation strategy. | Databases | Encryption | Local storage devices | Cloud computing

Quiz type: radio, Which of the following are some best practices organizations must follow to protect their cloud resources and systems? | Run security monitoring tools periodically to ensure security threats and breaches are flagged | Distribute tasks, workloads, and monitoring software | Distribute tasks, workloads, and network traffic | Adopt a shared responsibility model of active monitoring for security and compliance
quizSrc.definition: Adopt a shared responsibility model of active monitoring for security and compliance

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of the following are key Identity and Access Management (IAM) components? | Protecting data while it is at rest, in motion, and in use | Embedding security through the life cycle of an application | Cloud Directory Services, Audits, and Compliance | Encryption security practices
quizSrc.definition: Cloud Directory Services, Audits, and Compliance

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of these statements is true of cloud encryption? A. Encryption ensures that only authorized users have access to sensitive data. B. When encrypted data is intercepted without authorization, it is unreadable and meaningless? C. Encryption protects data when it is at rest, in transit, and in use in memo. D. Encryption eliminates data security risks. | A and C only | A, B, and C only | A, B, C, and D | A, B, and D only

Quiz type: radio, Identify some of the standard cloud monitoring best practices from the provided options. | Encrypt data before it is sent to the cloud. | Encrypt data on a physical storage device. | Authenticate users attempting to access their cloud resources. | Leverage end-user experience monitoring solutions to capture the performance of an application from the point of view of its end users and track the usage and cost of your cloud resources and services.
quizSrc.definition: Leverage end-user experience monitoring solutions to capture the performance of an application from the point of view of its end users and track the usage and cost of your cloud resources and services.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, What are some of the monitoring tools that help you to gain insights about your posture, compliance, and threats? | Flow logs and hypervisors | Flow logs from the network and security events | Data encryption | Hypervisors
quizSrc.definition: Flow logs from the network and security events

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, What are some of the benefits of using access groups? | The use of access groups helps to reduce the number of policies in an account. Access groups provide a more streamlined way to assign access rights. | Access groups help increase the number of policies of an account. | Access groups create an additional level of authentication for application users. | Access groups define the users, the resources to which access is granted, and the permission level each user has on these resources.
quizSrc.definition: The use of access groups helps to reduce the number of policies in an account. Access groups provide a more streamlined way to assign access rights.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Identify the two main parts of an encryption system from the provided options. | Client-side encryption | Physical encryption device | The encryption algorithm and decryption key | Server-side encryption
quizSrc.definition: The encryption algorithm and decryption key

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: checkbox, What are some of the benefits that cloud monitoring solutions offer? | Prevent unauthorized users from accessing the systems | Troubleshoot applications and infrastructure | Enhanced security to user accounts | Accelerate the diagnosis and resolution of performance incidents and provide proactive notifications of abnormal or unusual situations.
quizSrc.definition: Troubleshoot applications and infrastructure|Accelerate the diagnosis and resolution of performance incidents and provide proactive notifications of abnormal or unusual situations.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, The Weather Company migrated its weather web property to a secure, scalable, and global architecture in the IBM Cloud. What benefits did they realize as a result of this migration? | Increase development and increased latency | Faster development and release of new apps and digital self-service tools to customers | Increase asset availability and overall equipment effectiveness | Harness local data centers to minimize latency for users and optimize their systems for elasticity in handling extreme spikes in demand
quizSrc.definition: Harness local data centers to minimize latency for users and optimize their systems for elasticity in handling extreme spikes in demand

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, What is an API? | A version control system used to manage your code | A framework which dictates the architecture of your program and controls the program flow | Code that works with data and provides a mechanism for software to access resources from the back-end | A practice for dev-ops teams enabling developers to deliver frequent changes reliably
quizSrc.definition: Code that works with data and provides a mechanism for software to access resources from the back-end

Quiz type: radio, What is the relation between Git and GitHub? | GitHub is a main section in the Git project workflow.  | GitHub is an online hosting service for Git repositories.  | GitHub is a program required for version control on Git.  | GitHub is an open-source tool used to create Git.
quizSrc.definition: GitHub is an online hosting service for Git repositories.

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, Which of the following describes a repository? | A basic unit of storage in Git that cannot be changed  | A collection of user accounts that are connected to a pull request  | A data structure that stores documents and source code | A plain text file that explains the purpose of a project
quizSrc.definition: A data structure that stores documents and source code

quizSrc.term: Quiz type: radio, What is the purpose of a license?  | To describe the purpose of the project | To establish a secure remote login between computers | To record all changes made to a repository | To express how people can use your code

Quiz type: radio, What type of version control system is Git? | Centralized | Remote | Local | Distributed

Quiz type: radio, Which of the following statements is associated with a working directory? | A separate line of development that allows one to work independently | Copy of a repository | Contains the files and subdirectories on the computer that are associated with a Git repository | Contains project folders that are set up for version control
quizSrc.definition: Contains the files and subdirectories on the computer that are associated with a Git repository

quizSrc.definition: Data can only flow from parent components to child components.
